content.question: Which of the following correctly identifies an example of an endocrine disruptor and the effect it might have on the human body?

choices.label: High levels of lead in drinking water could lead to neurological damage.
Exposure to radon in indoor air is linked to increased rates of lung cancer.
Phthalates in cosmetics and shampoos reduce fertility.
The bacterium E. coli found in vegetables causes abdominal cramping and vomiting.

content.answer: Phthalates in cosmetics and shampoos reduce fertility.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
